item.title: Arfin India Ltd Stock Hits All-Time High Amid Strong Market Performance
item.description: Arfin India Ltd, a key player in the Non - Ferrous Metals sector, has surged to a new all-time high of Rs.74.78, reflecting a significant achievement in its market journey. This milestone underscores the company’s robust performance and sustained upward momentum over recent periods. Time: 5 minutes ago

item.title: Sensex Edges Higher as Small Caps Lead; ITC Drags Amid Mixed Sector Performance
item.description: The Indian equity market closed marginally higher on 1 January 2026, with the Sensex gaining 82.68 points, or 0.10%, to settle at 85,303.28. Market breadth remained positive as 262 stocks advanced against 234 decliners on the BSE500, reflecting cautious optimism among investors amid mixed sectoral performances and subdued midcap activity. Time: 12 minutes ago

item.title: Eternal Ltd Faces Challenges Despite Nifty 50 Membership and Large Cap Status
item.description: Eternal Ltd, a prominent player in the E-Retail and E-Commerce sector, continues to navigate a challenging market environment despite its prestigious inclusion in the Nifty 50 index. Recent institutional holding changes and a downgrade in its Mojo Grade to Sell have added complexity to the stock’s outlook, even as it remains a large-cap heavyweight with a market capitalisation exceeding ₹2.68 lakh crores. Time: 16 minutes ago

item.title: Max Healthcare Institute Ltd Faces Sell Grade Amidst Nifty 50 Membership Significance
item.description: Max Healthcare Institute Ltd, a prominent hospital sector player and constituent of the Nifty 50 index, has experienced a mixed performance trajectory amid evolving market dynamics. Despite its large-cap status and benchmark inclusion, the stock’s recent financial metrics and institutional holding trends suggest caution for investors navigating the healthcare space. Time: 16 minutes ago
